alert.note: Alert for San Diego County Deserts; San Diego County Inland Valleys; San Diego County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 4:07PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central San Diego County through 500 PM PDT... At 406 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hwy 78 Between Banner And S2, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hwy 78 Between Banner And S2, Julian, Hwy 78 Between S2 And Borrego Springs Rd, Hwy 79 Between Julian And Lake Cuyamaca, Lake Cuyamaca, Hwy S2 Between Hwy 79 And Hwy 78, Hwy 78 Between Ramona And Santa Ysabel, Banner, Wynola, Shelter Valley, Santa Ysabel, and Santa Ysabel Indian Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
